movies.title: The Girl in Blue
movies.plot: Scott, a smug Montreal lawyer, searches for the girl of his dreams whom he met briefly four summers previously, when she was in a sports car on a tiny ferry going to an island in the St. Lawrence. Meanwhile, his girlfriend Bonnie is pressuring him to marry her.
movies.simplePlot: Scott, a smug Montreal lawyer, searches for the girl of his dreams whom he met briefly four summers previously, when she was in a sports car on a tiny ferry going to an island in the St. ...

biography.bio: Actor David Selby, highly regarded for his villainous work on both daytime and nighttime soap classics, was born in Morgantown, West Virginia. He attended West Virginia University and graduated with both B.S. and M.A. degrees from West Virginia University, then earned a Ph.D. from Southern Illinois University in Carbondale. Following many years on the stock stage (from 1961), David finally attracted infamous attention when he signed on as Quentin Collins, a werewolf, on the gothic daytime drama "Dark Shadows" in 1968. He inherited heartthrob status briefly with the role and even recorded two songs during the show's run, "Quentin's Theme" and "I Wanna Dance With You." After the series' demise, he made his movie debut with Night of Dark Shadows (1971), the second film based on the cult series. He broached top film stardom in the early 1970s after co-starring with Barbra Streisand in Up the Sandbox (1972) and Ron Leibman in The Super Cops (1974), and continued his high-profiled pace with New York theatre productions of "The Heiress" (1976), with Jane Alexander and Richard Kiley, and "Eccentricities of a Nightingale" (1976) with Betsy Palmer, but things didn't quite pan out. In the 1980s, however, steady TV work helped put an extra shot of adrenalin back into David's career, notably as the cunning Richard Channing on the nighttime soap "Falcon Crest," a role he played from 1982 until 1990. David has graced most of the popular series over the years including "The Waltons," "Police Woman," "Kojak," "Family," "Touched by an Angel," and "Ally McBeal." He has also appeared sporadically in white-collar film support with roles in Dying Young (1991), White Squall (1996) and Surviving Christmas (2004) to his credit. David continues to perform on stage as well. He portrayed Abraham Lincoln in his own play "Lincoln and James" in 1997 and 1998, and penned the play "Final Assault" which premiered in 2003. He is a staple player in radio drama with the L.A. Theatre Works these days. David and longtime wife Chip have three children.
biography.name: David Selby

biography.bio: Stunning Swedish born ex-model who broke into film in 1970, and quickly appeared in several high profile films including playing the ex-wife of James Caan in the futuristic Rollerball (1975) and the ill-fated lover of super-assassin Francisco Scaramanga played by Christopher Lee in The Man with the Golden Gun (1974). To date, the beautiful Maud Adams has appeared in three James Bond films... the other two performances were as one of the lead villains in Octopussy (1983) and as an extra in A View to a Kill (1985). She has appeared in numerous television specials on the Bond series of films, and also played the love interest of crazy Bruce Dern in Tattoo (1981). In the late 1990s, Adams had a regular role on a Swedish soap opera; however, she has not been seen on cinema screens since late 1996.
biography.name: Maud Adams

biography.bio: Gay Rowan was born in 1948 in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. She is an actress, known for The Starlost (1973), The Girl in Blue (1973) and Sudden Fury (1975).
biography.name: Gay Rowan

biography.bio: William Osler was born on May 16, 1933 in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada as William Edmund Osler. He was an actor, known for The Girl in Blue (1973), When Michael Calls (1972) and The Starlost (1973). He was married to Heather Macdonald. He died on January 26, 2008 in Cape Breton, Nova Scotia, Canada.
biography.name: William Osler

biography.bio: Diane Dewey was born in 1943. She is an actress, known for Middle Age Crazy (1980), The Girl in Blue (1973) and Rip-Off (1971).
biography.name: Diane Dewey

biography.bio: Michael Kirby was born on February 20, 1925 in Sydney, Nova Scotia, Canada. He was an actor and writer, known for Shadows and Fog (1991), Arrête de ramer, t'es sur le sable (1979) and Swoon (1992). He died on May 25, 2002 in Orange County, California, USA.
biography.name: Michael Kirby

biography.bio: Walter Wakefield is an actor, known for The Girl in Blue (1973), The Huntsman (1972) and Don't Let the Angels Fall (1969).
biography.name: Walter Wakefield

biography.bio: Don Arioli was born on September 2, 1936 in Rochester, New York, USA. He was a writer and actor, known for La maison de Jean-Jacques (1968), Hot Stuff (1971) and The Little Lulu Show (1995). He was married to Rosemarie Shapley. He died on October 4, 2005 in Devon, England.
biography.name: Don Arioli

biography.bio: Valda Dalton was an actress, known for Rabid (1977), Bravery in the Field (1979) and The Girl in Blue (1973). She died on January 31, 1991 in Montreal, Canada.
biography.name: Valda Dalton

biography.bio: Guy Martin is an actor, known for The Girl in Blue (1973), Flucht nach vorn (1983) and The Girl with the Golden Eyes (1961).
biography.name: Guy Martin

biography.bio: Michel Maillot was born in 1926 as Michel Max Maillot. He was an actor and writer, known for The Peanut Butter Solution (1985), Quintet (1979) and The Girl in Blue (1973). He died on September 6, 1999 in Saint-Bruno-de-Montarville, Québec, Canada.
biography.name: Michel Maillot

biography.bio: Hanna Poznanska was an actress, known for Shivers (1975), The Girl in Blue (1973) and Strangers at the Door (1977). She died in January 1998.
biography.name: Hanna Poznanska

biography.bio: George R. Robertson is a Canadian actor best known as Chief Hurst in the first 6 Police Academy films. He was also featured in JFK, Murder At 1600 (Mack Falls), as Dick Cheney in The Path To 9/11 and, most recently as Chester Jones in Still Mine. He appeared as Barry Goldwater in The Reagans, as Sen. Fulbright in The Pentagon Papers and as Adm. William Leahy in Hiroshima.
biography.name: George R. Robertson

biography.bio: Elsa Pickthorne is an actress, known for The Girl in Blue (1973), Mousey (1974) and Threshold (1981).
biography.name: Elsa Pickthorne

biography.bio: Donald Ewer was born on September 10, 1923 in London, England. He is an actor, known for Spider (2002), A Child's Christmas in Wales (1987) and On My Own (1991).
biography.name: Donald Ewer
